qas.question: Who had now been appointed as a military advisor to the emperor of Seleucid?
What was thought to be the plan of Hannibal and the emperor of Seleucid?

answers.text: an outright conquest not just of Greece, but of Rome itself

qas.question: Which empire currently controlled the majority of the former Persian Empire?
Who had managed to recreate nearly the entirety of the empire of Alexander the Great?
Which former enemy wanted an alliance with the Romans?

context: With Egypt and Macedonia weakened, the Seleucid Empire made increasingly aggressive and successful attempts to conquer the entire Greek world. Now not only Rome's allies against Philip, but even <a4_0>Philip<a4_0/> himself, sought a Roman alliance against the Seleucids. The situation was made worse by the fact that <a0_0>Hannibal<a0_0/> was now a chief military advisor to the Seleucid emperor, and the two were believed to be planning <a1_0>an outright conquest not just of Greece, but of Rome itself<a1_0/>. The <a2_0><a3_0>Seleucids<a3_0/><a2_0/> were much stronger than the Macedonians had ever been, because they controlled much of the former Persian Empire, and by now had almost entirely reassembled Alexander the Great's former empire.
